  1. Description

Annotation Interface MarkerInterface

@Documented @DesignPattern(EXTENSIBILITY) @Retention(SOURCE) @Target({TYPE,METHOD,CONSTRUCTOR}) public @interface MarkerInterface
Indicates that the annotated type or member is a Marker Interface pattern.

A marker interface (also known as a tagging interface) is an interface with no methods, used to "tag" or "mark" a class or component as having a particular semantic role. The presence of the marker is then detected by frameworks, tools, or reflection logic to enable special behavior without modifying the existing code.

Examples in the Java standard library include:

  • Serializable — marks a class as capable of being serialized
  • Cloneable — marks a class as supporting Object.clone()
  • Remote — marks a class as usable for remote method invocation

This annotation belongs to the EXTENSIBILITY category, since marker interfaces provide a lightweight mechanism for systems to be extended, customized, or configured without altering the code of the marked class.

Intended usage:

  • On an interface that is designed to serve as a marker interface
  • Optionally on methods or constructors when a framework uses markers on call sites

See Also:
  • Serializable
  • Cloneable
  • Remote
